segments.pli: “Sattahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu nacirasseva catasso paṭisambhidā sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a mendicant with seven qualities will soon realize the four kinds of textual analysis and live having achieved them with their own insight.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṃ me cetaso līnattan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is mental sluggishness’.

segments.pli: ajjhattaṃ saṅkhittaṃ vā cittaṃ ‘ajjhattaṃ me saṅkhittaṃ cittan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: They truly understand internally constricted mind as ‘internally constricted mind’.

segments.pli: bahiddhā vikkhittaṃ vā cittaṃ ‘bahiddhā me vikkhittaṃ cittan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: They truly understand externally scattered mind as ‘externally scattered mind’.

segments.pli: tassa viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti;
segments.en: They know feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

segments.pli: viditā saññā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti;
segments.en: They know perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

segments.pli: viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti;
segments.en: They know thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

segments.pli: sappāyāsappāyesu kho panassa dhammesu hīnappaṇītesu kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgesu nimittaṃ suggahitaṃ hoti sumanasikataṃ sūpadhāritaṃ suppaṭividdhaṃ paññāya.
segments.en: The patterns of qualities—suitable or unsuitable, inferior or superior, or those on the side of dark or bright—are properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu nacirasseva catasso paṭisambhidā sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyā”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these seven qualities will soon realize the four kinds of textual analysis and live having achieved them with their own insight.”
